verses.roman:
diṣṭyā tvāṁ vihitaṁ mṛtyum
ayam āsāditaḥ svayam
vikramyainaṁ mṛdhe hatvā
lokān ādhehi śarmaṇi

synonyms: diṣṭyā—by fortune; tvām—to You; vihitam—ordained; mṛtyum—death; ayam—this demon; āsāditaḥ—has come; svayam—of his own accord; vikramya—exhibiting Your prowess; enam—him; mṛdhe—in the duel; hatvā—killing; lokān—the worlds; ādhehi—establish; śarmaṇi—in peace.
translation: This demon, luckily for us, has come of his own accord to You, his death ordained by You; therefore, exhibiting Your ways, kill him in the duel and establish the worlds in peace.
